title: What happens to TikTok? Six ways the fight to ban it could play out
description: The uncertainty around a TikTok ban has left the app’s millions of users and critics with an option question: What’s going to happen to it?

title: Democrats condemn Texas abortion pill ruling and the Trump judge who issued it
description: Democrats quickly condemned the Friday decision by U.S. District Judge Matthew Kacsmaryk to suspend the FDA's longtime approval of a key abortion pill.

title: How a tight circle of aides is trying to keep Trump out of (more) trouble
description: Donald Trump has a close, insular circle of aides who are helping him stay focused trying to avoid drama as he navigates the campaign and investigations.

title: At least 6 injured after high school senior skip day ends in shooting on South Carolina beach
description: A shooting on a South Carolina beach left at least six people injured on Friday while high school seniors were skipping school before Spring break was set to start, police said.

title: ‘I got catfished by a sandwich’: Virtual kitchens boom on delivery apps
description: From Big Hot Dog Energy to Pimp My Pasta, there’s a growing wave of restaurants in the U.S. that are luring patrons with clickbait names and glossy imagery.

title: In his final moments, an Indiana middle schooler blamed bullies for his suicide. Could a state bill have saved him?
description: Terry Badger, 13, killed himself in March, leaving behind a video in which he blamed his bullies. A state bill aims to end bullying and save other kids.

title: Maryland parish was home to a dozen priests accused of child sexual abuse
description: Maryland parish was home to a dozen accused predator priests

title: A judge suspended FDA approval of an abortion pill. Does the other one work on its own?
description: A Texas judge is suspending the FDA's approval of the abortion pill mifepristone. Will the remaining pill, misoprostol, work? What are the side effects?

title: Shooter scare at University of Oklahoma may have been prompted by 'bogus' call, police say
description: Police descended on the University of Oklahoma on Friday night after a report of an active shooter and later found no sign of a shooting and no injuries, officials said.
